sentences.en: Aircraft production continued to plod along at an agonizingly slow pace.
sentences.cn: 飞机制造业仍旧举步维艰，发展速度之缓很让人头疼。

sentences.en: An aircraft overshot the runway and was severely damaged.
sentences.cn: 一架飞机冲出了跑道，严重受损。

sentences.en: He had returned to England in an aircraft carrier no less.
sentences.cn: 他竟然坐航空母舰回的英格兰。

sentences.en: Jets of compressed air gave the aircraft lateral and directional stability.
sentences.cn: 压缩空气的喷吐使飞机的左右和前后都能保持稳定。

sentences.en: Reid was forced to bail out of the crippled aircraft.
sentences.cn: 里德不得不从严重受损的飞机上跳伞逃生。

sentences.en: The air reeked of kerosene and huge aircraft rumbled overhead.
sentences.cn: 空气中散发着煤油味，巨型飞机在头顶隆隆地响着。

sentences.en: The aircraft bumped along erratically without gathering anything like sufficient speed.
sentences.cn: 飞机忽上忽下，飞行很不平稳，根本未达到应有的速度。

sentences.en: The aircraft made an unscheduled landing after developing an electrical fault.
sentences.cn: 飞机由于发生电力故障而作了临时降落。

sentences.en: The airlines have invested enormous sums in new, quieter aircraft.
sentences.cn: 航空公司投入了大笔资金购买噪音较小的新型飞机。

sentences.en: The deal would have reduced competition in the commuter-aircraft market.
sentences.cn: 这项协议原本会减少通勤航班市场的竞争。

sentences.en: The engine note changed as the aircraft landed, taxied and halted.
sentences.cn: 发动机的声音随着飞机着陆、滑行和停下一直在变化。

sentences.en: The landowners have had to sell their private aircraft.
sentences.cn: 这些土地所有者不得不卖掉自己的私人飞机。

sentences.en: The return flight of the aircraft was delayed.
sentences.cn: 飞机的返回航程被推迟了。

sentences.en: The two wings of the aircraft broke off on impact.
sentences.cn: 飞机的两个机翼遭受撞击折断了。

sentences.en: Tomorrow he would tell his pilot to get the aircraft ready.
sentences.cn: 明天他会告诉他的飞行员准备好飞机。

sentences.en: You can watch aircraft take off or land at close quarters.
sentences.cn: 你可以近距离观察飞机的起降。

phrases.tran_cn: n. 航空母舰；全能篮球中锋

trans.tran_en: a plane or other vehicle that can fly
